reviewText: This is a single disc collection with five episodes from the 'Best Food Ever' series on TLC. The narrator for this show is John Goodman(he does not actually appear before the camera).My favorite episode in this collection is 'Fab Food Carts' as it was nice to see hard-working folks who are passionate about food go about making their entrepreneurial dreams into a reality. It was also amusing seeing a heavy-metal pig truck!Overall this collection is a bit short and could have used an additional disc for a few more episodes. But overall what is here is fun to watch and recommended for lovers of food programs.
summary: Fun to watch but only five episodes
Title: N/A

reviewText: Love how this video was put together, it had all the best places where you can go and get great food!  They even show you the how to recipes and they interview the people that eat there and their cooks.  I highly recommend that if you are looking for the best places to get great food then you should watch this show.

reviewText: I like these shows as it allows me to sit up and eat my own cooking and imagine it might be as good as that prepare in this series.  We don't have any restaurants like this in my yuppie want a be town.  In face any decent restaurant that does locate here is quickly run into the ground.  They are too concerned with profit and little about taste and value.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was a bit skeptical of purchasing this DVD as John Goodman (Rosanne) is a comedic actor, and wasnt sure if he could pull off narrating... but after watching, I really enjoyed watching the DVD.  Entertaining and a pleasure to indulge yourself in seeing what other people find delicious.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this show because host John Goodman has obvious enthusiasm for food and doesn't make it all about him like the host of a similar show I've watched.  One warning: I think I put on ten pounds just watching this!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay so seriously, I LOVE this show.I hope they make more episodes in the future!They basically select a food topic, and go around the country showing the viewer the best 10 places in the US to find that food item.
